item.title: Whats up with the
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

[quote=“Andrew Ferguson, post:21, topic:430834”][quote author=_s link=topic=533513.msg3900131#msg3900131 date=1327693914]

Why doesn’t anybody ever understand the concept of anonymous besides Andrew? There is no group, there anonymous and anyone who says otherwise or claims to be isn’t anonymous obviously.

As for the whining about correct grammar on the internet, get real.
This is Moparscape, n0b0dy give da fuck bout dee grammar bruh
[/quote]Anonymous is a group though, and its unstructured, anarchistic and dynamic nature makes it a uniquity.

Anonymous is a set of ideas, you can believe in that group and be a follower of that idea but saying you are part of it is like saying you a part of the idea. Ill use a religion for an example. You can believe in the religion and go to church everyday, but that doesn’t make you “Christianity” it makes you a follower of the ideas and values. When you go look at the bible you don’t see yourself in it because you act on it’s ideals. Same concept for Anonymous.[/quote]following the ideals and morality of Christianity makes one a Christian, and one can identify as part of the religious group of Christians, and in rhythm with your own interpretation, one could equally call themselves a member of Anonymous, identify with the Anonymous collective and follow Anonymous’ ideologies.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @lemme_winks lemme_winks_

@lemme_winks wrote:

[quote=“Andrew Ferguson, post:21, topic:430834”][quote author=_s link=topic=533513.msg3900131#msg3900131 date=1327693914]

Why doesn’t anybody ever understand the concept of anonymous besides Andrew? There is no group, there anonymous and anyone who says otherwise or claims to be isn’t anonymous obviously.

As for the whining about correct grammar on the internet, get real.
This is Moparscape, n0b0dy give da fuck bout dee grammar bruh
[/quote]Anonymous is a group though, and its unstructured, anarchistic and dynamic nature makes it a uniquity.

Anonymous is a set of ideas, you can believe in that group and be a follower of that idea but saying you are part of it is like saying you a part of the idea. Ill use a religion for an example. You can believe in the religion and go to church everyday, but that doesn’t make you “Christianity” it makes you a follower of the ideas and values. When you go look at the bible you don’t see yourself in it because you act on it’s ideals. Same concept for Anonymous.[/quote]

en.wikipedia.org

Anonymous (group)

Anonymous is a decentralized international hacktivist group that is widely known for its various DDOS cyber attacks against several governments, government institutions & government agencies, corporations, and the Church of Scientology. Anonymous originated in 2003 on the imageboard 4chan, representing the concept of many online and offline community users simultaneously existing as an anarchic, digitized global brain. Anonymous members (known as "Anons") can be distinguished in public by the wea...

Read full topic

item.title: Whats up with the
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:11, topic:430834”][quote author=vManlyMan link=topic=533513.msg3900082#msg3900082 date=1327690453]

You should get better vocabulary… And grammar.

It works.

Yes like all these kiddie hackers call themselves anonymous…

Yes, it works, but it makes you look like an immature 9 year old who doesn’t know how to insult someone without using the words ‘fag’ and ‘gay’.

And the ‘kiddie hackers’ have taken down PSN, FBI.gov, CIA.com, Whitehouse.gov. I don’t think they’re ‘kiddie hackers’. They’re hackers.
[/quote]

Lol no,
Just join their IRC and you can join,
CIA hasn’t been taken down
whitehouse neither
FBI, UMG, RPAA, RIAA, justice, and a few french music companies, yes.

It’s all with LOIC, kids who don’t know shit about hacking just come help to DOS

There are some real hackers yeah, but only a very small part

&& anonymous is all the people who support the ideas, not a group of hackers

get facts or gtfo
tits are good to[/quote]technically LOIC’s typical usage is a distributed DoS (DDoS) as there almost always is more than one participant in the flooding, what distinguishes it though is how it’s hivemind feature is like an opt-in botnet where you willfully contribute your computer and internet connection for usage in taking websites down.

Read full topic

item.title: Whats up with the
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

Your grammar hurts my soul. Also on another note, don’t even think about the “Anonymous” hackers, because anyone who actually believes in the ideals of Anonymous isn’t going around saying “Oh we hacked you, here is the new world order”. The idea of Anonymous is to promote freedom and all these “hackers” (by which I mean someone who set up a R.A.T. in 3 seconds and attached it to a porno download) tell everyone what the new world order is, even though the idea of Anonymous is to make the order of the world yourself.

All in all, just ignore it, not even worth giving attention to.

Read full topic

item.title: Whats up with the
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

if you look at this retard’s signature, he’s got ‘Freecoding > Mopar’ with a link to his site Freecoding @ http://www.freecoding.smfnew.com. if you look at the frontpage, he’s been hacked by Anonymous hence the butthurt. in other words, this kid is angry because his security sucks. hooray.

also, Anonymous aren’t really as much a group of hackers as they appear to be. it’s just a collective group of (not so) anonymous internet users with a political message and a few hackers amongst them, they’re not all hackers by any stretch of the imagination, more of an international, web based political group focused on freedom and equality, although this may be a generalisation.

Read full topic
